p: SHUV infection and replication in biting midges seems more efficient compared to other biting midge-borne viruses such as SBV and bluetongue virus (BTV), which generally show infection rates up to 30% [ 32â€“ 36]. Both SBV and BTV have caused sudden and large-scale epizootics in Europe, with devastating consequences for the livestock sector [ 37, 38]. The relatively high susceptibility and efficiency of replication in biting midges, and recent spread of SHUV to areas outside Sub-Saharan Africa [ 13], should therefore be interpreted as a warning for its epizootic potential.
